page.title: The 6 Main Kavalactones
page.subtitle: Detailed effect profiles of the six most important active compounds in Piper methysticum.

einfuehrung.paragraph1: Kavalactones (also known as Kava-Pyrones) are a group of lactones that occur exclusively in the genus Piper. They are responsible for over 96% of the pharmacological effects of Kava and differ fundamentally from the alkaloids found in other psychoactive plants such as coffee or tea.
einfuehrung.paragraph2: To date, 18 different kavalactones have been identified in Piper methysticum, but six of them make up the majority of the total concentration and determine the effect profile of a Kava variety. These "Major Kavalactones" are coded with the numbers 1-6 and form the basis of the chemotype system.

struktur.title: Chemical Structure
struktur.intro: All kavalactones share a common backbone: a α-pyron ring (a six-membered lactone ring) connected to a phenyl ring. The differences between the individual kavalactones arise from:

items.label: Methylenedioxy groups
items.text: Methysticin and Dihydromethysticin possess this group, which explains their longer duration of action.

items.label: Degree of saturation
items.text: The "Dihydro" variants (DHK, DHM) have a saturated side chain, which increases their lipophilicity and thus bioavailability.

items.label: Methoxy groups
items.text: Yangonin and Desmethoxyyangonin differ by the presence or absence of a methoxy group.

uebersicht.title: The 6 Main Kavalactones in Detail
uebersicht.intro: Each of the six main kavalactones has a unique pharmacological profile. Understanding these individual effects is crucial for predicting the overall effect of a Kava variety based on its chemotype.

kavain.name: Kavain (K)
kavain.subtitle: The "Lead Kavalactone" for Noble Kava
kavain.description: Kavain is considered the most important kavalactone for quality assessment. It is the main contributor to the characteristic "Heady" effect – a clear, focused relaxation without sedation. Noble Kava varieties almost always start with Kavain (4) in the first or second position of the chemotype.
kavain.clinicalNote: Clinical Relevance: Kavain has been tested as a single substance in several clinical studies and showed significant anxiolytic effects – comparable to benzodiazepines, but without their potential for dependence.

dihydrokavain.name: Dihydrokavain (DHK)
dihydrokavain.subtitle: The "Body Relaxer"
dihydrokavain.description: Dihydrokavain is the hydrogenated form of Kavain and is characterized by a particularly strong muscle-relaxing and analgesic effect. It is metabolized more slowly than Kavain, leading to a longer but gentler effect.
dihydrokavain.typicalFor: Typical for: "Heavy" Kava varieties like Borogu or Palarasul, which are consumed in the evening for relaxation.

methysticin.name: Methysticin (M)
methysticin.subtitle: The neuroprotective kavalactone
methysticin.description: Methysticin is characterized by its methylenedioxy group, which gives it special pharmacological properties. It acts strongly sedating and anxiolytic, but also shows interesting neuroprotective properties in preclinical studies.

dihydromethysticin.name: Dihydromethysticin (DHM)
dihydromethysticin.subtitle: The "Tudei Marker" Kavalactone
dihydromethysticin.description: Dihydromethysticin is the kavalactone with the longest half-life and is metabolized very slowly by the body. High DHM concentrations are the main feature of "Tudei" (Two-Day) Kava – varieties that can cause days of fatigue and nausea.
dihydromethysticin.warning: Important: If DHM (5) is in the first or second position of a chemotype, it is likely Tudei Kava. Such varieties are not permitted for export in Vanuatu and should be avoided.

yangonin.name: Yangonin (Y)
yangonin.subtitle: The endocannabinoid-active kavalactone
yangonin.description: Yangonin is unique among the kavalactones as it has a proven affinity for the CB1 receptor of the endocannabinoid system. This partially explains the euphoric and mood-enhancing effects of Kava, which can resemble cannabis – without causing psychotomimetic effects.

desmethoxyyangonin.name: Desmethoxyyangonin (DMY)
desmethoxyyangonin.subtitle: The dopamine booster
desmethoxyyangonin.description: Desmethoxyyangonin differs from Yangonin by the absence of a methoxy group. It has a pronounced effect on the dopaminergic system and contributes to the focusing and motivating component of the Kava effect.

wirkmechanismen.title: Mechanisms of Action of Kavalactones
wirkmechanismen.intro: Kavalactones affect the central nervous system on multiple levels simultaneously. This multimodality explains why the Kava effect is so unique and differs from other anxiolytics:

synergien.title: Synergies & Entourage Effect
synergien.paragraph1: Similar to cannabis (terpenes & cannabinoids), in Kava the whole extract is more effective than isolated kavalactones. This is referred to as the entourage effect.
synergien.quote: Isolated Kavain is anxiolytic, but the combination with Yangonin (MAO-B inhibition) and Desmethoxyyangonin (dopamine increase) significantly enhances the mood-lifting effect.
synergien.paragraph2: Therefore, traditional preparations (water extraction from the whole root) or full-spectrum extracts are preferred over isolated active ingredients. The natural balance of kavalactones, as found in Noble Kava, has been optimized through selection over millennia.
synergien.practicalText: When purchasing Kava products, attention should be paid to full-spectrum extracts or traditionally prepared Kava. Products with isolated Kavain or standardized single active ingredients often do not provide the same effect profile as the natural root.

navigation.chemotypenDescription: How the 6-digit code predicts the effect
